answers.answer: Infection is a possible cause, and can lead to the nausea.If the symptoms continue, obtaining an upper endoscopy or upper GI series can be done to exclude various upper GI diseases like GERD, an ulcer, or inflammation of the upper digestive tract.An ultrasound of the gallbladder should also be done, as well as a CT scan to evaluate the pancreas, as diseases here can lead to nausea.These options can be discussed with your GI physician.Followup with your personal physician is essential.This answer is not intended as and does not substitute for medical advice - the information presented is for patient education only. Please see your personal physician for further evaluation of your individual case.Kevin, M.D.www.kevinmd.com
